title: New release at some point?
author: FrankyBoy
body_snippet:
Hi, the last release was in 2019. Since then there have been quite literally hundreds of commits, including features which are mentioned in the documentation but not to be found in the release version.

So are there any plans to provide a) a new stable release or b) unstable/testing releases in the future?

iterations.description: Stale - 'New release?' question, v1.79.0 and v1.80.0 now exist

comments.author: ltctech
comments.snippet:
I see constant updates to the project so it's definitely not dead. Kind of odd that no new preview builds are being released. From what I understand the last v1.77.3-nb is broken and people are recommending v1.77.2.

I am still using v1.76.20 but it is getting somewhat long in the tooth.

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: 1.77.3-nb is not broken :) its disabled saving to settings due current refactoring of a way mR save settings, and to avoid a mess with working version because overwise it may create a mess due people don't read warning for NB version (its a beta test and definitely not for production - however it could be used in production environment, but we don't want to disturb oficial released in that case)

comments.author: Neustradamus
comments.snippet:
@FrankyBoy: I am happy that I am not alone! :)

I have done a ticket 2020-05-25 about it:
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/1765

Latest stable version is 1.76.20 (2019-04-12):
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/releases/tag/v1.76.20

And there are several CVEs in the latest current stable version:
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues?q=is%3Aissue+cve

Linked to:
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/1765
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemot...

comments.author: lars18th
comments.snippet:
> 1.77.3-nb is not broken :) its disabled saving to settings ...

Sorry @Kvarkas , but without settings enabled the NB is completly useless. Also, this version of NB is very old. Please consider the advantage of providing an alpha NB release every month with all settings enabled despite the state of development.

Thank you.

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: just you don't get purpose of nb its doesn't mean it's useless :) its dedicated to test not for work! :) but yes more often releases of NB will start happening soon

comments.author: lars18th
comments.snippet:
> just you don't get purpose of nb its doesn't mean it's useless :) its dedicated to test not for work! :)

IMHO if we can't configure/store a lot of complex parameters for a large list of different servers in the settings then I simply can't test anything. All "settings disabled versions" of mRemoteNG are only placebo releases. We can't test anything with them.

> but yes more often releases of NB will start happening soon

Good news for my ears! üëç

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: for this version its a must due refactoring how we save settings to avoid mess with a "normal" settings for production app ;) however in next release it will be enabled as it will switch to a new method and you will be welcome to test all functionality ;)

comments.author: lars18th
comments.snippet:
Hi @Kvarkas ,

Why not focus *now* on *only* refactor the save settings? Any other improvement is useless because we can't use a version without settings saving functionality.

comments.author: simonregn
comments.snippet:
Hi @Kvarkas,
is there any Update on the settings refactoring topic? Do you have any plans when we'll see a new release? I'd love to see a new version to test. Especially since the current stable version contains an increasing number of Security issues.

comments.author: Neustradamus
comments.snippet:
@Kvarkas: Any progress on a new stable version with CVE fixes?
Security of users are very IMPORTANT.

Recall: I have done a ticket 2020-05-25, more 5 years ago:
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/1765

Latest stable version is 1.76.20 (2019-04-12):
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/releases/tag/v1.76.20

And there are several CVEs in the latest current stable version:
- https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues?q=is%3Aissue+cve

Thanks in advance.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.

Current legacy version labels: 1.77.3

comments.author: Neustradamus
comments.snippet:
@robertpopa22: No, the latest is always 1.76.20 (2019-04-12).
A lot of CVEs, etc.

notes: Manual triage: Meta issue asking for a new release. v1.79.0 and v1.80.0 Community Editions have been published. Not an actionable bug/feature request.
